activities.loc: Branch I, Courthouse Annex, Second Floor

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dijon Lavonte Carter

defendant.name: Carter, Dijon Lavonte

10:32 AM Defendant Dijon Lavonte Carter appeared by ZOOM, in custody at Ozaukee County Jail.  Attorney Amy C Scholz appeared by ZOOM for Dijon Lavonte Carter.  Attorney Kathryn E Heineck in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court calls cases 22CF70, 22CF127, and 22CF145.
Atty Scholz heard and requests another status.
Has not had sufficient time to discuss all charges with Deft since his being taken into custody last week in Ozaukee County.
Deft heard - does not know how long he will be in custody at Ozaukee County Jail.
Atty Scholz requests ZOOM appearance for her and the Deft at the next hearing.
Court schedules with parties.

Status conference scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Atty Scholz is being heard regarding missed court date by defendant
DA is being heard on bail - requests $2500 additional cash for bail

Court will not increase the cash bail
Court is being heard on arraignment
Copy of information
Atty Scholz enters not guilty pleas on all three cases
Court schedules Status
DA is being heard on $10,000 signature bond on 22CF145
Atty Scholz is being heard
Court grants $10,000 signature bond - Sign Waiver of Extradition.  No possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Dijon Lavonte Carter in court.  Attorney Amy C Scholz in court for Dijon Lavonte Carter.  Attorney DeShea Morrow in court for State of Wisconsin.
